suncertify.client
Class ClientModel

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      suncertify.client.ClientModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel
final class ClientModel
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel

Client MVC model. This is a model of the search results table. Thread safety: not thread safe

Field Detail

HIDDEN_COLUMN

public static final int HIDDEN_COLUMN
Special flag indicating a "hidden column" used to store the record number. The record number can be retrieved by calling getValueAt with HIDDEN_COLUMN as the columnIndex parameter.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

getColumnName

public java.lang.String getColumnName(int columnIndex)
Returns a localized name for the column that has the given index. If there is no translation for the column, returns the field name.

Specified by:
getColumnName in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
Overrides:

public java.lang.Object getValueAt(int rowIndex,
                                   int columnIndex)
Returns the value for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.

Parameters:

Returns:

setRowData

void setRowData(java.util.List<Record> newRows)
Changes the row data to the specified list of records. The records are expected to match the current schema.

Parameters:
newRows - the records that will form the new table rows
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if newRows is null

modifyRecord

void modifyRecord(Record newRecord)
Overwrites a record with the given record. The record that gets overwritten will be the one that has the same record number as the given record. Note that this does not change the record on the server.

Parameters:
newRecord - the new record

getRecord

Record getRecord(int recordNumber)
Get the record with the given record number. Note that the record number will probably be different from the row index.

Parameters:
recordNumber - the record number
Returns:
the record with the given record number
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if recordNumber does not correspond to a record in the table.

setSchema

void setSchema(TableSchema schema)
Change the schema of the table to the given schema. This removes all rows from the table.

Parameters:
schema - the new schema to use. May be null.

setSearchResultTotal

void setSearchResultTotal(int resultCount)

Parameters:
resultCount - the new total
